lead_paragraph: Thomas Berdych overcame a partisan crowd and the defending champion, Rafael Nadal of Spain, in the quarterfinals at the Madrid Masters yesterday, beating the second-ranked Nadal, 6-3, 7-6 (6). Nadal’s loss prevented his expected meeting against top-ranked Roger Federer, who moved a step closer to winning his 10th title of the year with a 6-3, 7-6 (4) victory against Robby Ginepri.
